alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 7:29AM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The Corralitos Creek continues to rise rapidly and flooding is likely. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...The Corralitos Creek in Santa Cruz county. * WHEN...Until 130 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 AM PST, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Watsonville, Corralitos, Freedom, Amesti, Interlaken, Brown Valley Road, Aptos Hills-Larkin Valley and Day Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
